intro: Juncoides racemosa, commonly known as the clustered rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Juncaceae. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems that are typically unbranched and covered in a dense layer of fine, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a spike-like inflorescence at the top of the stem. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found in temperate regions. Juncoides racemosa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
